description:
An open-source alternative to Claude Cowork, powered by OpenCode

OpenWork is an extensible, open-source “Claude Work” style system for knowledge workers.
It’s a native desktop app that runs OpenCode under the hood, but presents it as a clean, guided workflow:
- pick a workspace
- start a run
- watch progress + plan updates
- approve permissions when needed
- reuse what works (templates + skills)
The goal: make “agentic work” feel like a product, not a terminal.
Highlights
- Add MCP server add/remove UX with confirmation and OAuth-friendly defaults in the app.
- Improve desktop release reliability by bundling a control-chrome shim sidecar executable.
Fixes & polish
- Fix owpenbot direct-send routing to use the workspace identity directory.
- Allow openwork-server direct-send to resolve the active identity more reliably.
Packaging / ops
- Bump all OpenWork package versions to 0.11.61 and refresh lockfiles/manifests.
- Update AUR packaging metadata and docker dev compose bits for the release.
Compare:
https://github.com/different-ai/openwork/compare/v0.11.60...v0.11.61
